NIST Uncertainy Machine UI/UX Audit

Or, how to make things look and work better!

Home Page - Default

User Interface

UI Fields

  • Total: 13
  • 7 Instruction Bullet List Step
  • 6 Text Fields
  • 2 Options List
  • 4 Buttons
  • 2 Checkboxes
  • 1 Drag and Drop/File Upload

Observations

  • Font and input sizes are too small! A modular scale and better vertical rhythm would increase visual flow.
  • Spacing and padding increases will help emphasize/isolate each step in the form fillout process.
  • Bold headers and lighter text will clue the user on how to use the form.
  • Overall look and feel is boring and looks 'technical'. A stronger font, and some small but impactful UI improvements for the field inputs would go a long way!

User Experience

  • instruction steps are listed as bullet points, hard to understand the proper order of operations
  • there is no step by step with details for each field input
  • Bold headers and lighter text will clue the user on how to use the form.
  • visual hierarchy is very poor based from the first three points, modular scale would help
  • file upload is very nice, but is there a sample config file for a user to see?
  • names of input quantities is visually clunky, why does it start with 0x instead of 1x?
  • generator seed can exceed 100, user’s manual says it cannot exceed that
  • R expression text areas lack a grid structure layout when more than 1 is displayed
  • field validations should be on the same screen, not on new tab after pressing compute

Home Page - Maximum Inputs

User Interface

UI Fields

  • Total: 337
  • 7 Instruction Bullet List Step
  • 303 Text Fields
  • 10 Text Areas
  • 17 Options List
  • 4 Buttons
  • 2 Checkboxes
  • 1 Drag and Drop/File Upload

Observations

  • Font and input sizes are too small! A modular scale and better vertical rhythm would increase visual flow.
  • Spacing and padding increases will help emphasize/isolate each step in the form fillout process.
  • Bold headers and lighter text will clue the user on how to use the form.
  • Overall look and feel is boring and looks 'technical'. A stronger font, and some small but impactful UI improvements for the field inputs would go a long way!

User Experience

  • lacks grid layout when many text input fields are displayed, hard to map fields to other associated fields (names of input quantities)
  • how does the R expression map to field names?
